1.text: Pick up the chopsticks with your dominant hand.

2.text: Place your hand right around the top third of the chopsticks.

3.text: Rest the lower chopstick across the base of your thumb and ring finger.

4.text: Grip the upper chopstick between your index finger, middle finger, and thumb.

5.text: Keep your thumb from moving as much as possible.

6.text: Open and close the chopsticks with your first two fingers.

7.text: Keep a firm grip on both chopsticks to keep them from shifting.

8.text: Maintain gentle pressure on the top chopstick to hold onto your food.

9.text: Reverse the opening-closing motion to tear food into smaller pieces.

10.text: Never stick your chopsticks straight up in a bowl of rice.

11.text: Always use both chopsticks at the same time.

12.text: Avoid laying your chopsticks across your plate or bowl unless you’re done, especially at formal meals or restaurants.

13.text: Try not to gesture with your chopsticks or point them at other people.

14.text: Move dishes with your hands, not your chopsticks.

15.text: Don’t eat or take food from the serving dish with your personal chopsticks if you are being offered serving chopsticks.
